Function.Name: Abs
Function.Description: Returns the absolute value of an integer.
Function.ReturnDescription: An integer.

Function.Name: Abs
Function.Description: Returns the absolute value of a decimal number.
Function.ReturnDescription: A decimal number.

Function.Name: Abs
Function.Description: Returns the absolute value of a floating-point number.
Function.ReturnDescription: A floating-point number.

Function.Name: Div
Function.Description: Returns result of dividing a value1 and a value2. If the value2 is zero, then the result is 0.
Function.ReturnDescription: Result of checking.

Function.Name: Div
Function.Description: Returns the result of dividing a value1 and a value2. If the value2 is zero, then the result is zeroResult (third argument).
Function.ReturnDescription: The result of checking.

Function.Name: Div
Function.Description: Returns the result of dividing a value1 and a value2. If the value2 is zero, then the result is equal to 0.
Function.ReturnDescription: Result of checking.

Function.Name: Div
Function.Description: Returns the result of dividing a value1 and a value2. If the value2 is zero, then the result is zeroResult (third argument).
Function.ReturnDescription: Result of checking.

Function.Name: Div
Function.Description: Returns the result of dividing a value1 and a value2. If the value2 is zero, then the result is 0.
Function.ReturnDescription: Result of checking.

Function.Name: Div
Function.Description: Returns result of dividing value1 and value2. If value2 is zero, then result is zeroResult (third argument).
Function.ReturnDescription: Result of checking.

Function.Name: Sign
Function.Description: Returns a value indicating the sign of an integer.
Function.ReturnDescription: A number indicating the sign of a value. -1 value is less than zero. 0 value is equal to zero. 1 value is greater than zero.

Function.Name: Sign
Function.Description: Returns a value indicating the sign of a decimal number.
Function.ReturnDescription: A number indicating the sign of a value. -1 value is less than zero. 0 value is equal to zero. 1 value is greater than zero.

Function.Name: Sign
Function.Description: Returns a value indicating the sign of a floating-point number.
Function.ReturnDescription: A number indicating the sign of a value. -1 value is less than zero. 0 value is equal to zero. 1 value is greater than zero.

Function.Name: Round
Function.Description: Rounds a decimal value to the nearest integer.
Function.ReturnDescription: The nearest integer parameter value. If the value is halfway between two integers, one of which is even and the other is odd, then the even number is returned.
Function.ArgumentDescription: A decimal number to be rounded.

Function.Name: Round
Function.Description: Rounds a decimal value to the nearest integer.
Function.ReturnDescription: The number nearest to a value with a precision equal to decimals. If the value is halfway between two numbers, one of which is even and the other odd, then the even number is returned. If the precision of value is less than decimals, then value is returned unchanged.
Function.ArgumentDescription: A decimal number to be rounded.
The number of significant decimal places (precision) in the return value.

Function.Name: Round
Function.Description: Rounds a floating-point value to the nearest integer.
Function.ReturnDescription: The nearest integer parameter value. If the value is halfway between two integers, one of which is even and the other odd, then the even number is returned.
Function.ArgumentDescription: A floating-point number to be rounded.

Function.Name: Round
Function.Description: Rounds a floating-point value to the nearest integer.
Function.ReturnDescription: The number nearest value with a precision equal to decimals. If the value is halfway between two numbers, one of which is even and the other odd, then the even number is returned. If the precision of a value is less than decimals, then the value is returned unchanged.
Function.ArgumentDescription: A floating-point number to be rounded.
The number of significant decimal places (precision) in the return value.

Function.Name: Truncate
Function.Description: Calculates an integral part of the specified decimal number.
Function.ReturnDescription: The integral part of a value; that is, the number that remains after any fractional digits have been discarded.

Function.Name: Truncate
Function.Description: Calculates the integral part of a specified floating-point number.
Function.ReturnDescription: An integral part of a value; that is, the number that remains after any fractional digits were discarded.

Function.Name: Sin
Function.Description: Returns the sine of the specified angle.
Function.ReturnDescription: The sine of an angle.

Function.Name: Cos
Function.Description: Returns the cosine of the specified angle.
Function.ReturnDescription: The cosine of an angle.

Function.Name: Tan
Function.Description: Returns the tangent of the specified angle.
Function.ReturnDescription: The tangent of an angle.

Function.Name: Acos
Function.Description: Returns an angle which cosine is the specified number.
Function.ReturnDescription: An angle, measured in radians.

Function.Name: Asin
Function.Description: Returns the angle which sine is the specified number.
Function.ReturnDescription: An angle, measured in radians.

Function.Name: Atan
Function.Description: Returns the angle which tangent is the specified number.
Function.ReturnDescription: An angle, measured in radians.

Function.Name: Sqrt
Function.Description: Returns the square root of a specified number.
Function.ReturnDescription: Return the positive square root of value.

Function.Name: Exp
Function.Description: Returns e raised to the specified power.
Function.ReturnDescription: The number e raised to the power value.

Function.Name: Log
Function.Description: Returns the natural (base e) logarithm of a specified number.
Function.ReturnDescription: Returns the natural logarithm of a value.
Function.ArgumentDescription: A number which logarithm is to be found.

Function.Name: Maximum
Function.Description: Returns the larger of two floating-point numbers.
Function.ReturnDescription: Parameter val1 or val2, whichever is larger.
Function.ArgumentDescription: The first of two floating-point numbers to compare.
The second of two floating-point numbers to compare.

Function.Name: Maximum
Function.Description: Returns the larger of two decimal numbers.
Function.ReturnDescription: Parameter val1 or val2, whichever is larger.
Function.ArgumentDescription: The first of two decimal numbers to compare.
The second of two decimal numbers to compare.

Function.Name: Maximum
Function.Description: Returns the larger of two integers numbers.
Function.ReturnDescription: Parameter val1 or val2, whichever is larger.
Function.ArgumentDescription: The first of two integer numbers to compare.
The second of two integer numbers to compare.

Function.Name: Minimum
Function.Description: Returns the smaller of two floating-point numbers.
Function.ReturnDescription: Parameter val1 or val2, whichever is smaller.
Function.ArgumentDescription: The first of two floating-point numbers to compare.
The second of two floating-point numbers to compare.

Function.Name: Minimum
Function.Description: Returns the smaller of two decimal numbers.
Function.ReturnDescription: Parameter val1 or val2, whichever is smaller.
Function.ArgumentDescription: The first of two decimal numbers to compare.
The second of two decimal numbers to compare.

Function.Name: Minimum
Function.Description: Returns the smaller of two integer numbers.
Function.ReturnDescription: Parameter val1 or val2, whichever is smaller.
Function.ArgumentDescription: The first of two integer numbers to compare.
The second of two integer numbers to compare.

Function.Name: Ceiling
Function.Description: Returns the smallest integer greater than or equal to the specified floating-point number.
Function.ReturnDescription: The smallest integer greater or equal to value.

Function.Name: Ceiling
Function.Description: Returns the smallest integer greater or equal to the specified decimal number.
Function.ReturnDescription: The smallest integer greater or equal to value.

Function.Name: Floor
Function.Description: Returns the largest integer less or equal to the specified floating-point number.
Function.ReturnDescription: The largest integer less or equal to value.

Function.Name: Floor
Function.Description: Returns the largest integer less or equal to the specified decimal number.
Function.ReturnDescription: The largest integer less or equal to d.
